thread.title: Treston Decoud discharged from hospital after scary collision
thread.title_full: Treston Decoud discharged from hospital after scary collision | OregonLive.com

author: Danny Moran | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Treston Decoud discharged from hospital after scary collision
text:
CORVALLIS â€“ Oregon State junior cornerback Treston Decoud was discharged from Good Samaritan Regional Medical Center in Corvallis on Saturday after leaving Reser Stadium in an ambulance earlier in the night.
Decoud was injured with 12:16 to play in the second quarter against Colorado following a collision while he attempted to make a tackle. He rejoined the team at the stadium following the Beavers' 17-13 loss .
"He was in the locker room and he appears to be fine," Oregon State head coach Gary Andersen said. "It's good for all of us to know he's back."
Decoud remained motionless on the field for several minutes after a teammate's helmet collided with the right side of his head and neck. Medical staff removed his facemask, placed him on a backboard and loaded him into an ambulance as a silent crowd looked on.
Redshirt freshman running back Ryan Nall said the team was informed at halftime that Decoud would be OK.
"That gave us a good reassurance," Nall said. "When our brother goes down, it's hard. You've got to do everything you can to pull yourself together and just get back in the game."
-- Danny Moran
dmoran@oregonian.com
@DannyJMoran
